```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
install.packages("readxl")
library("readxl")
```

```{r}
ImageryAreas <- read_excel("ImageryStatistics150m.xlsx")
```


```{r}
library(dplyr)

# Load your data into a data frame (if not already)
# ImageryAreas <- read.table("your_data_file.txt", header = TRUE)  # Example for loading data

# Step 1: Convert the data frame columns to numeric where applicable
ImageryAreas <- ImageryAreas %>%
  # Ensure all area columns are numeric; this converts columns 2 onward, assuming column 1 is a label
  mutate(across(-1, as.numeric)) %>%
  # Remove any rows or columns with NA values
  na.omit()

# Step 2: Prepare data for Chi-squared by removing the category column if needed
chi2_data <- ImageryAreas[, -1]  # Removes the first column if it is a label

# Step 3: Perform Chi-squared test
# Note: Chi-squared tests require integer values, so round if necessary
chi2_data <- round(chi2_data)
chisq.test(chi2_data)
View(chi2_data)

qchisq()

```
